session_startup: Run git status to check branch
Read this file to find current task
Find first task where status=pending and blocked_by=null

tasks.name: Scan all docs for AI-ism patterns
steps: Search for header patterns: 'The Problem', 'The Solution', 'Why This Matters', 'Key Takeaways'
Search for filler: 'worth noting', 'at its core', 'simply put', 'in today's world'
Search for openers: 'Whether you're', 'Imagine', 'Think of it as'
Document all findings with file:line references
acceptance_criteria: Complete inventory of AI-isms in docs
Each instance documented with location and suggested fix

tasks.name: Rewrite introduction.md
steps: Replace 'The Problem' header with descriptive alternative (e.g., 'Without common-repo' or just remove header)
Replace 'The Solution' header with descriptive alternative (e.g., 'How it works' or remove)
Rewrite bullet points in direct, technical language

tasks.name: Review and fix getting-started.md
steps: Fix any AI-isms identified in scan
Ensure instructions are direct and clear

tasks.name: Review and fix configuration.md
steps: Fix any AI-isms identified in scan

tasks.name: Review and fix remaining doc files
steps: Fix any AI-isms in each file
acceptance_criteria: No AI-isms remain in any file

tasks.name: Final consistency review
steps: Read through all docs in order
Check for consistent tone and style
Build docs with mdbook build docs/ to verify

notes: Goal: docs should read like a developer wrote them, not a chatbot
Avoid over-correction - some phrases are fine in moderation
Focus on clarity and usefulness over stylistic perfection
